posts.title: Wrap up round 2021.2
posts.html:
Congrats to Doth for winning the round with a total score of 12166.5! This is the first round where the 10k score was broken, by two people nonetheless! In total 71 people participated in this round for a total score of 77960.51.

posts.title: Wrap up round 2020.8
posts.html:
Congrats to Xaxiduru for winning the round with a total score of 2119! In total 31 people participated in this round for a total score of 5943.54.

Japanese29 readers
Latin2 readers
Turkish1 reader
German1 reader

Thank you all for participating!

After this round I've started thinking about the rules of the contest and have decided to add a new rule.

Frequency of submitting updates
You should be posting updates in regular intervals, preferably daily. Submitting everything you've read at the end of the contest isn't in line with the spirit of the contest. Tadoku is supposed to motivate people to read more, and in order to keep things fair updates should be somewhat regular. Participants who keep posting irregular (large) updates will be removed from the contest. Repeat offenders may be banned from future rounds.

This won't be applied retroactively, but it will be enforced starting next round.

Thank you all for participating! Round 7 has already started and you can still sign up for it! I've also added Latin and Hungarian to the supported languages list by request.

You might have also noticed that the Unseen Japan forum has migrated under the Tadoku umbrella. If you're curious about why this happened, you can read up on it in the discussion we had about it on the forum.
